असाधारण  
EXTRAORDINARY  
भाग II—खण् ड 3—उप-खण् ड (i)  
PART II —Section 3 —Sub-section ( i) 
प्राजधकार  से प्रकाजित  
PUBLISHED BY AUTHORITY  
सड़क पररवहन और राजमागग मंत्रालय  
अजधसूचना  
नई ददल्ली , 25 मई, 2022  
सा.का.जन. 394(अ).—सभी व् यजयय  से पपजतिययां और सझझाव पमंजत्रत करते ुए , जवत् तीय वषग 2022 -23 के 
जलए मोटर परपक्षकार प्रीजमयम और देयता जनयम का प्रारूप मोटर यान अजधजनयम , 1988 (1988 का 59) की धारा 
212 की उप -धारा (1) की अपेक्षानझसार भारत सरकार के सड़क पररवहन और राजमागग मंत्रालय की अजधसूचना , भारत के 
राजपत्र , असाधारण , भाग II, खंड 3 , उपखंड ( i) में अजधसूचना संख् या सा.का.जन. 215(अ) , तारीख 17 माचग , 2022 द्वारा 
प्रकाजित दकए गए थे ; 
और, उक् त राजपत्र अजधसूचना की प्रजतयां 21 माचग , 2022 को जनता को उपलब् ध  करा दी गयं थं ;

extra_info.file_name: Motor Vehicles (Third Party Insurance Base Premium and Liability) Rules, 2022.pdf

__data__.text:
करा दी गयं थं ; 
और, केंद्रीय सरकार द्वारा उक् त  प्रारूप जनयम  के स्‍  न् ध में जनता से प्रा्‍ त  पपजतियय  औ र सझझाव  पर स्‍ य क 
रूप से जवचार कर जलया गया था ; 
अत:, अ  केन् द्रीय सरकार , मोटर यान अजधजनयम , 1988 (1988 का 59) की धारा 147 की उप -धारा (2) द्वारा 
प्रदत् त िजयय  का प्रयोग करते ुए भारतीय  ीमा जवजनयामक और जवकास प्राजधकरण के परामिग से जन्नलजलजखत जनयम 
 नाती है अथागत्: - 
1. संजक्ष्‍ त नाम और प्रार्‍ भ  – (1) इन जनयम  का संजक्ष्‍ त  नाम मोटर यान (परपक्षकार प्रीजमयम मूल और देयता) जनयम , 
2022 है।  
(2) यह 01 जून, 2022 से प्रवृत् त ह गे। 
2. मूल प्रीजमयम और देयता - वाहन  के जवजभन्न वगों के जलए असीजमत देयता के जल ए परपक्षकार  ीमा के जलए मूल 
प्रीजमयम नीचे दी गई सारणी में जनर्ददष्टानझसार दकया जाएगा ;

रट्‍ पण: 
i. िैक्षजणक संस्ट्थान  स से एक  स अजभप्रेत है , जो दकसी कॉलेज , स्ट्कूल या अन्य िैक्षजणक संस्ट्थान के स्ट्वाजमत्व में है और

extra_info.file_name: Motor Vehicles (Third Party Insurance Base Premium and Liability) Rules, 2022.pdf

__data__.text:
और 
पूरी तरह से िैक्षजणक संस्ट्थान के छात्र  या कमगचाररय  को इसकी दकसी भी दियाकलाप के सं ंध में पररवहन के प्रयोजन से 
उपयोग दकया जाता है।  
ii. पझरानी कार  के रूप में रजजस्ट् री कृत उन जनजी कार  के जलए पूवगवतभार भारतीय मोटर टैरर  की पधार दर के 50% के 
ररयायती मूल् य  को अनझमोददत दकया गया है।  
iii. हाइजिड इलेजक्रक वाहन  के जलए मोटर टीपी प्रीजमयम दर  पर 7.5% की छूट स्ट्वीका र की जाती है।  
iv. सभी दर  को जनकटतम रुपये में पूणाांदकत दकया जाएगा।  
v. सारजणय  के अधीन वाहन  की श्रेणी का अजभप्राय , केंद्रीय मोटर यान जनयमावली , 1989 के अधीन वाहन  की दकसी 
जविेष श्रेणी में जनर्ददष् टा नझसार होगा।  
[ ा. सं. परटी -11036/194/2021 -एमवीएल ]  
अजमत वरदान , संयझय सजचव

__data__.text:
8  THE  GAZETTE  OF INDIA : EXTRAORDINARY     [PART II—SEC. 3(i)] 
MINISTRY OF ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS  
NOTIFICATION  
New Delhi, the 25th May, 2022  
G.S.R . 394(E).—Whereas draf t rules for Motor Third Party Premium and Liability Rules for the 
Financial Year 2022 -23 were published, as required by sub -section (1) of section 212 of the Motor Vehicle 
Act, 1988 (59 of 1988), vide notification of the Government of India in the Ministry  of Road Transport and 
Highways, number G.S.R. 215 (E), dated the 17th March, 2022 in the Gazette of India, Extraordinary, Part -
II, Section 3, Sub -section (i) inviting objections and suggestions from all persons;  
And whereas, copies of the said notificatio n were made available to the public on 21st  March, 
2022;  
And whereas, the objections and suggestions received from the public in respect of the said draft 
rules have been duly considered by the Central Government;  
Now, therefore, in exercise of the powers  conferred by sub -section (2) of section 147 of the Motor 
Vehicles Act, 1988 (59 of 1988), the Central Government in consultation with the Insurance Regulatory 
and Development Authority of India, hereby makes the following rules, namely: - 
1. Short title a nd commencement. – (1) These rules may be called as the Motor Vehicles (Third Party 
Insurance Base Premium and Liability) Rules, 2022.  
(2) They shall come into force on 1st June, 2022.  
2. Base premium and liability. – The base premium for third party insu rance for unlimited liability for 
the various classes of vehicles shall be as specified in the Tables given below; namely: - 
Table I

__data__.text:
[भाग II—खण् ड 3(i)] भारत का राजपत्र : असाधारण  13 
Note. - 
I. Educational institution bus means an omnibus, which is owned by a college, school or other 
educational institution and used solely for the purpose of transporting students or staff of the 
educational institution in connection with any of its activities.  
II. A discounted price of 50% of the premium based on the Indian Motor Tariff shall be allowed to a 
private car registered as Vintage Car.  
III. A discount of 7.5% on the premium shall  be allowed for Hybrid Electric Vehicle.  
IV. All rates of premium shall be rounded off to the nearest rupee.  
V. The category of vehicles under the Tables shall have the meaning assigned to a particular category 
of vehicles under Central Motor Vehicle Rules , 1989.  
[F. No. RT -11036/194/2021 -MVL]  
AMIT VARADAN , Jt. Secy.

extra_info.file_name: Motor Vehicles (Third Party Insurance Base Premium and Liability) Rules, 2022.pdf

__data__.text: The Motor Vehicles (Third Party Insurance Base Premium and Liability) Rules, 2022, published by the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, outlines the base premiums and liabilities for third-party insurance for various categories of motor vehicles. The rules provide the base premiums for motor vehicles with engine capacities of 1000cc and below, 1500cc and above, and 75cc and below. It also provides the base premiums for motor vehicles used for passenger transport, goods transport, and other vehicles such as house power rickshaws, electric vehicles, and motor trade vehicles. The rules also provide the base premiums for electric vehicles with engine capacities of 6HP and below, and other pneumatic and non-pneumatic vehicles with engine capacities of 15 and below. Finally, the rules provide the base premiums for motor vehicles used for passenger transport with engine capacities of 30kw and below, and 65kw and above.

The Motor Vehicles (Third Party Insurance Base Premium and Liability) Rules, 2022 outlines the base premiums and liabilities for motor vehicles in India. The rules cover a variety of vehicles, including motorised two wheelers, motorised three wheelers, motorised pedal cycles, four wheeled vehicles, trailers, agricultural tractors, and special types of vehicles. The rates for each type of vehicle vary depending on the size and type of vehicle. The rules also cover road transit risks and road risks for motor trade, with different rates for each.

The Motor Vehicles (Third Party Insurance Base Premium and Liability) Rules, 2022 provide rates for various types of vehicles, including three-wheeled vehicles used for carrying passengers with a carrying capacity not exceeding 6 passengers (C1b), four or more wheeled vehicles used for carrying passengers with a carrying capacity exceeding 6 passengers for hire and reward (C2), motorised three wheeled passenger vehicles used for carrying passengers for hire or reward with a carrying capacity exceeding 6 passengers but not exceeding 17 passengers (C3a), three wheeled vehicles used for carrying passengers for hire and reward with a carrying capacity exceeding 17 passengers (C3b), motorised two wheelers used for carrying passengers for hire or reward (C4), and quadricycles (Table VIII). The rates vary depending on the type of vehicle and the purpose for which it is used. Discounts are available for vintage cars and hybrid electric vehicles. The rules also provide long-term rates for three years single premium.
